title: Good storage and reliable but needs a better dashboard
name: Duy AnhMai
pros: "I use Oracle Database just for storage of the corporate database data and the finance data. "
cons: "The dashboard is not user-friendly."

title: Good high availability, data protection, and disaster recovery
name: Satishbabu Gunukula, Oracle ACE
pros: "Oracle Database is easy to install and set up. "
cons: "The high availability features are a little complex to set up and manage. "

title: Very robust, ideal for companies that need mission-critical databases, and extremely mature
name: Emmanuel Morka
pros: "The solution has very robust integrity due to how it is designed and implemented."
cons: "The solution can be quite expensive for small and medium-sized enterprises. Not too many companies can actually afford the pricing."

title: Reliable and robust with good support
name: Craig Domanski
pros: "The reliability is the solution's most valuable feature. We've had great success with the solution."
cons: "The main thing we find could use improvement is the licensing costs. It is quite expensive relative to other database vendors. Cost always comes up as an issue for us as we consider upgrade paths. It's not as easy as we would like it to be."

title: Supports a large volume of transactions compared to other databases
name: Gnanavel-Chakkarapani
pros:
"The tool supports a large volume of transactions compared to other databases we've used. One feature that had a significant impact is Oracle Data Integrator. It allows us to transfer data from the enterprise database to the data warehouse. This is useful for creating different data sets for finance teams and other departments.

"
cons:
"The tool's deployment and configuration is difficult. Sometimes, the network DNS settings aren't connected, so we need to check and enable the configuration, which is the difficult part. Maintenance requires a bit of effort. We need to monitor the database performance, check the number of concurrent users on Oracle, and handle any unwanted queries from users. You need at least two people to do it.

"

title: The migration process from other tools can be described as a simple process
name: Amey Darekar
pros: "The product's installation phase was straightforward."
cons: "Considering the current threats in the industry, my company has to put in efforts to update the tool, or we have to work on some more things so that we can have a secure environment."

title: Gets the job done, doesn't fail, and suitable for massively scalable applications
name: Paul Stearns
pros: "The thing that probably stands out the most about Oracle Database is reliability. I have been working with Oracle Databases for over 25 years, and I have never lost any data due to a machine going down or any events that were not stupid human tricks. I've never lost anybody's data using Oracle. It gets the job done and doesn't fail. "
cons: "There is a lot of room for improvement. Ease of use is probably the biggest complaint. They're getting somewhat better, but it is not as easy or intuitive as it could be in terms of maintaining and managing the database."

title: Enhances query performance, helps resource revision, and can analyze large datasets
name: VINCENTWU
pros: "Oracle can quickly expand its capacity to handle growing data needs by adding additional server resources."
cons: "Cost is always a concern."

title: Used for transaction system and internal data management system
name: AnkitKumar 1
pros: "Our internal data management system runs on Oracle Database."
cons: "The solution’s integration could be improved."

title: Provides excellent security features and is one of the oldest and most well-known databases
name: Sumeet  Zalpuri
pros: "The solution has every security aspect that needs to be there in enterprise software."
cons: "The stability could be improved."

title: Exceptional features with good availability, and reasonably priced
name: Vikas Dixit
pros: "All of the features offered by Oracle, more than meet the expectations."
cons: "As of now, Oracle is branded to Oracle only, the option of migrating to other databases is not available."

title: Handles large datasets seamlessly
name: Patric Gehl
pros: "The most valuable features of Oracle Database for data management are its ability to handle large datasets seamlessly, support for writing custom PL/SQL stored procedures, and its capability to perform complex computations and statistics directly within the database."
cons: "Improvements in Oracle Database could focus on simplifying deployment processes and providing clearer documentation."

title: Useful Enterprise Manager, beneficial automatic resource assigning, and high performance
name: Eva Kimathi
pros: "Oracle Database is running on the same old hardware that I had the 11g version on and it is operating faster. It seems to be really good. It's fast even when the workload is heavy, easy to do backups and other administrative tasks with the Enterprise Manager. "
cons: "Oracle Database has improved how we do our administrative backups. The solution has a smaller footprint than 11g, it's more efficient on the resources for the users. It has a smoother user experience with the ERP and fewer field transactions."

title: Offers security features that are good, reliable, and stable
name: reviewer2133219
pros: "The product's initial setup phase was very easy."
cons: "The high price of the product is an area of concern where improvements are required."

title: Highly reliable, perfectly stable, and scalable
name: PeterKrall
pros: "It is one of the most reliable database systems. "
cons:
"With the new version, we never came across any important limitations. There was nothing that needed improvement. However, in versions 9 and 10, we sometimes had problems, and big and complicated queries did not get through. In versions 11 and 12, I did not experience any problem.

There could be some more information about load balancing and all these things. For me, it was just a part of the infrastructure maintained by other people. So, I cannot really say what they need."

title: A efficient solution with fast processing feature
name: Chris Chris
pros:
"The tool is efficient and fast compared to other alternatives. The tool's processing speed is fast, and we've experienced minimal hang-ups. This enables us to address queries within a shorter time frame. I wouldn't say it's just one particular feature, but overall, the efficiency and speed of Oracle Database have had a significant impact. Our support systems are more efficient, allowing us to accomplish tasks quickly.

"
cons:
"The tool's price gap is a major concern. It makes it hard for others to afford it and use it effectively. More people could benefit from its features if the pricing could be made more reasonable. Many companies choose cheaper options because of this affordability issue.

"

title: Is robust, bug-free, and highly flexible
name: Tushar Rahatekar
pros: "It's very stable and highly available. I also like the row-level locking feature. It can manage billions of rows of data."
cons: "The initial setup could be easier."

title: Integrates well with other solutions and has good stability
name: Rafiq Tala'At
pros: " It meets our high availability, resilience, and large-scale data management requirements."
cons:
"The product requires higher expertise compared to Microsoft. It could be easy to use.

"

title: Offers good return on investment to users
name: Satya Raju
pros: "The solution's most valuable feature is the row-level security that helps mask and encrypt data."
cons: "Oracle Cloud has a bit of a learning curve, so from an improvement perspective, we need to have a simple way to connect to computing in Oracle Cloud."

title: Comes with encryption features and security is good
name: Sharique Rizvi
pros:
"The tool's most valuable feature is data encryption. The security features are good. They include field-level security, role-level security, and easy access controls.

"
cons:
"The tool is costly, and migration is hard. We need tools like Database Migration Assistant for Oracle to migrate data between databases. Sometimes, older versions of Oracle are no longer supported, making the transition even more difficult.

"

title: Ensures data security with robust features but needs better cost-effectiveness
name: Istiaque_Bhuiyan
pros: "It is highly secure, with an architecture that prevents hacking incidents, making it the most secure database available. "
cons: "The pricing could be more cost-effective, as the high price is driving some customers to consider migrating to open-source alternatives."

title: Offers performance optimization that has an excellent impact on the database
name: Paresh_Nayak
pros: "Oracle's performance optimization has had an excellent impact on our database."
cons: "Oracle itself does not provide an excellent migration tool to users, which is a shortcoming where the product needs to improve a lot."

title: High availability, scalability, load balancing, but expensive
name: MuhammadFurqan
pros: "It has good features for performance tuning."
cons: "The price could be lower."

title: A hybrid solution for ETL and real-time data analytics
name: Prajith Chowthee
pros: "The solution is easy to use. It also offers a Database Vault."
cons: "The pricing could be improved."

title: A capable and stable solution with good security and support
name: Chinthake Ranasinghe
pros: "The database capability and the security side of the database are the real valuable features. The cloud SaaS model is also valuable."
cons: "They can simplify and make the deployment more user-friendly. Deploying Oracle solutions requires a lot of technical input. If that can be improved, it would really add value to the business."

title: Scalable, reliable, but installation could be easier
name: Manjunath Bhimareddy
pros: "I have been satisfied with the technical support from Oracle."
cons: "I have been looking for a virtualization database engine from Oracle. They have third-party vendors that can do it but if Oracle comes with its own virtual engine, it would be helpful. Additionally, the solution could be more user-friendly and improve the Transparent Data Encryption. "

title: A very scalable and secure tool that offers very high-performance
name: reviewer1063128
pros: "In general, the product is strong enough and offers high performance."
cons: "How you implement or deploy the product can be an area of concern that can be made a bit easier. "

title: Performs well, easy to use, and the technical support is quite good
name: Kopano  Ramaphoi
pros: "In general, Oracle is quite good. It's a large database that houses many applications."
cons: "When you try to tell customers that you can critically patch their system, they always complain about the cost."

title: Easy to set up with good performance but is too expensive
name: Lakshman Nimmakayala
pros: "We find the solution to be stable."
cons: "They could improve the scalability a bit. There are other options that are more scalable, for example. "

title: It provides scalability, stability, reliability, performance, and security
name: reviewer1439427
pros:
"Scalability, reliability, and performance are what we are getting with this solution. It is highly scalable and has very good performance. It also has in-built monitoring and optimized optimizer.

It is quite stable and secure. When it comes to integration, you can integrate it with other tools as well. However, we have been using Oracle Database within our own premises. So, it is kind of difficult for us to basically do a kind of integration with the outside software. We prefer to do things within our own premises."
cons: "There are SQL plan flips that are happening with version 12c. We would basically like to have the next version wherein we don't see such plan flips because they create performance issues. There are quite a lot of features that I would like to see, but this is the main one for now."

title: Very secure, Highly scalable and high performance enterprise database
name: it_user515592
pros: "Stability and availability are the features I like the most in the solution."
cons: "The product's price can be lower since it is a bit of an expensive solution."

title: With multi-tenancy, you can set up background processes and memory at the container level.
name: it_user522033
pros: "It is very fast. The response times are very fast."
cons: "Its price can be improved. "

title: With great stability and availability as its features, the tool also makes it easy for users to scale up if needed
name: reviewer2239944
pros: "The support is always very helpful and responsive. "
cons: "The setup process can be a bit complex. "

title: Fast, very stable, and suitable for large sites
name: JohnMitchell
pros: "It is reliable. It's very stable. "
cons: "The solution can be quite expensive."

title: Flexible, with a variety of setup options and good technical support
name: Vishal_Goyal
pros: "The reporting feature was fine for what we were using it for. Oracle Database has been serving its purpose, and I was happy. "
cons: "Their migration strategies could be better because most of these companies keep the same version for six or seven years and then update it to the latest version."

title: Reliable and stable with excellent features
name: Omar Al-Qaysie
pros: "It is a mature product. It is pretty stable. I've got a lot of experience with it, so it is pretty easy to use."
cons: "The software really doesn't need any improvement, but the way they do the billing should be improved. They charge by all the chips on the server, whether you use them or not. If you have a server that has 64 chips on it and you use one chip, they charge you for 64, and that's a terrible business model."

title: A multi-model database management system with a useful reporting feature
name: Mpho Morake
pros: "Most of our customers have been using multitenant options. Advanced Compression and Advanced Security are the most valuable features in most customer environments."
cons: "The primary concern is that Oracle is highly restricted in terms of the approved technologies where we can freely deploy Oracle Database or any other Oracle product. "

title: One of the new features I've been using lately is the In-Memory column store.
name: it_user284961
pros: "Partitioning is most valuable."
cons: "The setup for Enterprise Manager Grid Control can be a bit easier."

title: Mature, stable, and easy to deploy
name: reviewer1089354
pros: "Oracle Database has good performance dynamics with respect to oncoming data and fetching of data which gets loaded."
cons: "They need to work on non-relational data a bit more. If Oracle Database can support non-relational data streaming, it would be great."

title: High-performance solution with lots of options for security, diagnostics and tuning
name: Deepak Nandal
pros: "The pricing is very competitive. Oracle is still the number one database company. From the technical aspects, Oracle Database is the best solution for small, medium, and big industries. "
cons:
"I'm in Indonesia. From what I know, Ali Cloud has already built a center in Indonesia, and Google also has a data center in Indonesia. I have heard that Amazon will also build a data center in Indonesia, and the same will be with Azure if they deal with the Indonesian government. I'm quite appreciative of what Amazon has done by deciding to have a local data center. I expect Oracle to do the same, but Oracle doesn't seem to have plans to build a data center in Indonesia. This is something that needs to be improved.

Oracle should follow all the other cloud providers who see a potential market in Indonesia. It would be better for Oracle to be equal to other cloud providers and have a data center in Indonesia so they can compete. Having a local data center means that they can avoid performance issues, the latency of the network, and all the things that are related to the network for internet-based solutions. Customers in Indonesia expect a local data center."

title: Oracle is our product of choice because of its stability, scalability, reliability, and flexibility.
name: it_user436173
pros: "Compared to other databases, Oracle Database is very simple to manage in terms of the database itself."
cons: "We use Oracle Database to run applications. We use it for our clients' databases and applications."

title: Partitioning is most valuable, and it is stable and fairly easy to set up
name: reviewer1715652
pros: "The product is expensive."
cons:
"If we make a mistake on the development side, we can recover it. However, we don't have this capability with other databases.

"

title: Has good performance dynamics and is stable, scalable, and easy to use
name: Prasad Bagaregari
pros:
"Oracle Database is expensive.

"
cons: "It enables us to comply with our security guidelines, and it is automated."

title: Competitive pricing, stable, and scalable
name: Arief Gunawan
pros: "The product could be cheaper."
cons: "The best features of Oracle Database Server are the security, high availability, and the Disaster Recovery solutions with the Data Guard. Specifically, on Autonomous Databases, the most valuable features are the automatic scaling and CPU scaling depending on the database workload. Today, the workload is normal and then suddenly the workload gets a spike."

title: The most valuable feature for me is the pluggable database because it provides database consolidation and the solution for utilizing your resource.

"

title: It's pretty straightforward, it's easy to manage, and there's pretty good support for it.
name: it_user27945
pros: "Sometimes, the patches supplied by Oracle to update the software do not work. "
cons: "I found the ease of backup, partitioning, and robust indexing most valuable. The main feature of Oracle is the structure of the database. The way your backups are taken on the online backup system and the way it restores and handles partitioning of your data are also valuable. Its performance is great, and it is also very flexible."

title: One of the features that stands out to me is the Real Application Cluster. This gives us the ability to have active-active clustering functionality.
name: it_user436020

title: Enables us to support applications
name: Jeremy Lee
pros: "Oracle needs to improve its cluster technologies. They need to improve in the cluster technology using ARC due to the fact that sometimes people think that they have a redundant server when they are using ARC with the cluster and think that will increase the performance. In reality, if they are using ii with a big workload, sometimes the performance is not increasing, and can sometimes actually impacts it in such a way that there's some degradation in the performance. "
cons:
"The platform's security features and stability are commendable.

"

"

The performance and security are very good, and it is user-friendly. There are a lot of people trained to use this solution which makes it simple to find assistance."

title: Great for building disaster recovery systems, very stable, and offers good scalability
name: Arief Gunawan
pros: "Oracle Database could improve by making migration less difficult and having better integration. For example, having the ability to communicate, using native features, to different databases. Mostly connectivity to different databases, such as open-source databases or any other database."
cons: "Oracle is a good database with decent performance, which is fortunate because we are required to use this database for our ERP system. Even if we thought Oracle was the worst database in the world, we would still have to use it."

cons: "As compared to SQL Server, Oracle Database performs better when you have a huge amount of data. We didn't face any problems when we had a huge amount of data. There were also no issues with importing/exporting and migrating the data."

Its deployment can be easier. It should be easier to configure for a developer. If a developer is planning a database and trying to configure it, it should be easy for him because many times, we cannot directly get help from DBAs."

You can use Oracle Database as a source for easily integrating with different databases and applications. It supports Java platforms and other applications very well. It works with SAP products better than Microsoft SQL Server."

title: Secure, performs well, easy to install and has a good dashboard
name: CarlosCastells
pros: "It should have more monitoring features. There should be features to be able to analyze the performance with a query. In Microsoft SQL Server, when you are running any stored procedure, if you want to analyze the performance, you just run the query analyzer. You can easily find out that something is missing in a joint condition, or clustering needs to be added because of a delay. I can't find such features in Oracle Database. They should be added."
cons: "You can scale the solution if you need to. Its scalability is good. "
